resources.string: Nothing describes Dallas to its essence as a beer garden. Truck yard is all that and more.A perfect no fuss come-as-you-are adult playground. Its great if you want to have a great time with locales and enjoy the outdoors while having a good time.It is also kid friendly.

Texas bbq at its finest.Expect a line for sure, but service is super effective.Found in the hip neighborhood of Deep Ellum and, just a couple minutes from downtown Dallas it is definitely worth the trip.You could always walk around the neighborhood and enjoy the other local businesses in the area.

Best burger in the whole of Dallas.Ingredients are fresh and they have hand punched fries.They got a wide selection of craft beers.If you visiting from out of town with your pets this place is perfect because it is also pet friendly.

Swankiest steakhouse in Dallas with about 100 chandeliers and a Ducati parked in the restaurant.Super great vibe for a date night or just you want to want to experience a rustic vibe with a touch of glitz.Great menu with raw bar,steaks and classic cocktails.

Galleria is shopping mall located near Interstate 635 and Dallas North Tollway.It was originally developed by Hines Interests Limited Partnership in 1982.It has beautiful ice skating at the center of the mall which Olympic athletes and Olympic champions perform on once in a while.

It has more than 235 unique retailers, restaurants and department stores.It is located at the intersection of loop 12 and US 75.This mall offers an unparalleled luxury shopping experience.It was originally opened in 1965.

Home to local vendors,merchants,artisans and craftmen of the area.It is located downtown Dallas.It opens 7 days a week but super fun to visit on weekends and ideal brunch location if you want to try a variety of local restaurants and food trucks.

An upscale shopping plaza located at the southwest corner of Mockingbird lane and Preston Road in Higland Park,Texas.It was also declared a National Historic landmark in 2000.It was the first self-contained shopping center in America.
Located in the Arts District of downtown Dallas, its a a 21st century reinterpretation of the traditional opera house.It is also one of the nations premier performing art venues.
A Dallas live music staple,it has been entertaining all ages in North Texas and everywhere else since 1946.It is located in Lower Greenville neighborhood in Dallas.
Located Uptown Dallas with great ambiance, it is prime spot if you want to enjoy live music from some popular bands.If you lucky during your vist you can catch a free concert too.

Found in the neighborhood of Deep Ellum, its the perfect if you want to two step to some honky tonk.It is also know t be the best country music in the area. Do not forget to bring your cowboy hat and your boots.

Found on the sixth floor at the Dealy Plaza which was formerly the Texas School Book Depository.It examines the life,times,death and legacy of President John F.Kennedy.It also located at the very spot from where President John F.Kennedy was shot by Lee Harvey Oswald.
The stockyards is a historic district in Fort Worth,Texas.The 98-acre portion encompassing much of the district was listed on the National Register of Historic places in 1976.

A conference and event center in Parker,Texas.The ranch includes the Ewing Mansion which was the set for the television show Dallas.You can also have a guided tour of the ranch to see memorabilia from the series.

It is one of the largest art museums in America and located in the arts district of downtown Dallas.It was founded in 1903.Its growing collection contains one of the most important holdings of modern and contemporary art in the U.S.
